snippet.title: Hinterland is developing a taste for food and music
snippet.content:
THE Maleny Supa IGA is hosting a free cooking workshop on Saturday, August 5. Chef Kate McAloon has previously worked with celebrities Sheryl Crow, Gwyneth Paltrow, Dwayne Johnson and Steven Spielberg, to name a few. The event is at the Maleny Community Centre from 11am-1pm. If you would like to participate and hear all about Kate's incredible food journey, book at http://bit.ly/Flavourofjoy Or call 5494 2257 or email dietitian@outridgeiga. com.au Loving Landsborough LANDSBOROUGH State School students' artwork will be displayed on Loving Landsborough Day on August 19. The display will be set up at the Landsborough Seventh Day Adventist Church Community Hall in Maleny St, Landsborough. An art competition will run in conjunction with the display for primary school students in the area. The theme for the competition is: What I love about Glasshouse Country. Any medium can be used. Prizes include Smiggle gift cards and art and craft packs. For more information, call Charles Russell on 0407 142 962. Photo contest THE 2018 Rotary Photo Competition is on, with the theme: Our Iconic Glass House Mountains. Chosen photos from the competition will appear in the 2018 calendar. Images are to be delivered to the Beerwah Library by Friday, September 1, with the entry form. For more details about the competition, call 0437 030 432. Gympie Music Muster THE Gympie Muster is on this month, from August 24-27, at a beautiful location in the Amamoor Forest. Day passes are quite reasonable, or you can camp there, too, if that is more your style. There is plenty of entertainment to suit everyone's music taste. On the line-up of talent this year, for example, is former Powderfinger guitarist Darren Middleton, who has won ARIA and APRA Awards with the iconic Aussie band, and is also an accomplished solo artist. The Muster is a definite must-go to for every hinterland local at least once. Visit Health checks WITH the winter cold still lingering, it is a good time to assess your health. Don't delay. Make an appointment and go see your health and wellness professional.
